title: What font is this?
content:
I know this is an ugly one, but I have to create a vector version and I'm not sure what this font is. It might be one of those Windows exclusive dealios. Thanks for your help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414153233im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Carefree_4498.jpg)
author: chiminichanga

comments.content:
It's not _that_ ugly. :-)

BTW if you mean it might be a Windows OS font that's not on OSX, there's actually a way to buy many of those, thanks to Ascender.  
 [http://www.ascenderfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414153233/http:/www.ascenderfonts.com/ "http://www.ascenderfonts.com/")

hhp

Could it be any of these (none of the letters are particularly unique):  
 [Gisha](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414153233/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?productid=876067)  
 [Leewaladee](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414153233/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?productid=876662)  
 [Segoe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414153233/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?productid=876345)  
Note - On many of Microsofts non-english fonts, such as YaHei, they put the Segoe glyphs into the Latin unicode slots.

- Herb
Crisp reference at a decent size, personally I’d just go ahead and draw it! It’s not like it would take very long (three of one character is a gift).

I found it, took me awhile :) It's a Microsoft Windows 7 packaged font named Ebrima.

A little history:  
Ebrima was designed to support a large number of African languages. The font contains characters for the Nko, Tifinagh, Vai and Osmanya writing scripts.

Thanks for the feedback everyone.

So/but it seems HVB was correct - and you can probably find an easier shortcut than tracking down Ebrima.

hhp
You would be done already if you’d drawn it ;-)
